title: Number and costs of employment tribunals and settlements for teachers

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please could you provide the following, in the form of a spreadsheet, in respect of teachers at any school maintained by Sheffield City Council, for a period of the past five years (Jan 1 2018 - February 28 2024), broken down year by year if possible:
1. The number of teachers who have launched employment tribunal proceedings against their employer (ie. The maintained school, its Executive Board, the council, etc)
2. The number of these cases that ended in an out-of-court cash settlement
3. The sum total of those cash settlements (I do not believe this would breach any non-disclosure agreements as it does not reveal how much any one individual received)
4. How many teachers have signed Non-disclosure agreements in respect of their employment tribunals?
Yours faithfully,
Alastair Ulke

Dear Alastair Ulke,
Thank you for your request for information relating to number and costs of
employment tribunals and settlements for teachers which we received on
28/02/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 27/03/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council

Dear FOI team,
Thank your for taking the time for that explanation.
I'm happy to accept that the numbers are low enough year-on-year that it could help someone identify the teachers in particular cases.
My enquiry initially asked for a year-by-year breakdown of the past five years. Would the information be more anonymised if I did not ask for this and just asked for a summary of the past five years? If the number of cases in the past five years is low enough still as to be identifiable, could I increase the number of years in the range? Hopefully there is an acceptable spot where the number of cases compared to the number of years covered makes it so teachers cannot be singled out.
Thank you for your time, best wishes,
Alastair Ulke
